title.narrative: PROVISION OF QUALITY COMPETENCY-BASED PRIMARY AND SECONDARY EDUCATION FOR CHILDRE

description.narrative: By 2022, government agencies (central and local) and educational institutions have strengthened their capacity to provide quality, competency-based primary and secondary education for children and adolescents aged 6-18 years old and ensure inclusive, violence- free learning environment for all with special focus on children with disabilities., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, all children and adolescents in Ukraine, especially those disadvantaged and affected by the conflict, access inclusive and quality school education and early learning while enjoying opportunities for meaningful participation and civic engagement.

related-activity.ref: 4410/A0/05/883 INCLUSIVE AND QUALITY SCHOOL EDUCATION AND EARLY LEARNING

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, government agencies (central and local) and educational institutions have strengthened their capacity to provide quality,competency-based primary and secondary education for children and adolescents aged 6-18 years old and ensure inclusive, violence-free learning environment for all with special focus on children with disabilities.

description.narrative: Despite global COVID-19 pandemic, the Government of Ukraine remained committed to implement education reform agenda aimed to sustain and improve learning outcomes and remove barriers constraining access to quality competency-based education for children and adolescents. UNICEF supported the Government to improve quality inclusive education, and also ensured safe and violence-free learning environment for children and adolescents with special focus on children with disabilities. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:23/01/2022
